rows.THE LIBRARIAN — FIRST HIRE: Maintains the master Trade. Extracts slices per person. Updates when work returns. No judgment. Pure custody.
WHAT THEY DO
1. Learn the Trade (Week 1 — read the architecture, understand the map)
2. Set up Google Drive structure (one folder per person)
3. Extract tabs into each person's folder when they're hired
4. Update the master Trade when work comes back graded/revised
5. Track status of every TUP (not started / in production / in review / verified / locked)
6. Answer 'where is X' instantly for anyone in the system
They are a registrar. They don't teach, grade, or decide. They file and distribute.
WHY FIRST HIRE
Before anyone else can touch the Trade, someone needs to know where everything is.
Nilo + Claude built 907 tabs. Only Nilo and Claude know what's in them.
The librarian is the bridge. They learn the system, then they hand it to everyone else.
Sequence:
Week 0: Nilo + Claude produce the Trade
Week 1: Librarian hired. Learns Trade. Sets up Google Drive. Hires admin.
Week 2: Admin starts. Librarian prepares MC folder. Admin screens for MC.
Week 3+: Every new hire gets a prepared folder from the librarian on Day 1.
COMP & PROFILE
Time: 2-3 hrs/day (grows as more people join, shrinks as system stabilizes)
Comp: $100-200/week + 0.5% equity
Profile: Detail-oriented. Comfortable with spreadsheets. Doesn't need to understand business strategy.
Think: library science student, executive assistant, project coordinator, virtual assistant.
Career booster: 'I was the information architect for a 900-tab venture studio launch.'
